intro: Merremia kentrocaulos, commonly known as the creeping morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its twining stems and heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink and purple. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in disturbed soils or along roadsides. Its rapid growth and invasive potential make it a notable species in ecological studies.
